documents.name: Bloomberg LP Machine Learning Internship
documents.description: During the summer 2022, I worked full-time at Bloomberg as a machine learning/software engineering intern, again at the 120 Park office in New York. I was working on a product that runs clustering on client inquiries. My project allowed me to get experience on both the research side and infrastructure side of the product. I worked on improving the clustering algorithm that my team published by adding functionality for cluster specified sizes. Additionally, more on the infrastructure side, I added document embedding caching since the clustering job preprocesses and vectorizes the last 6 months of data everyday, which leads to a lot of redundant preprocessing.

documents.name: GTRI Robotics Research Student Assistant
documents.description: Working as a part-time robotics research student assistant for Aerospace, Transportation & Advanced Systems Laboratory (ATAS) at GTRI. I worked on a robot named ARTI; ARTI currently had the capabilities to move around, take note of certain things, avoid obstacles, and take images all autonomously. I worked to build a machine learning framework for Object Detection using TensorRT and Nvidia Tau Toolkit to allow it run well on Nvidia Xaviers (the hardware in the robot)

documents.name: Undergraduate Researcher - Big Data & Quantum Mechanics
documents.description: Currently undergoing training on catalysis, density functional theory, computational chemistry methods, and machine learning methods. Concurrent with the training, I am working with a team to create a simulation to calculate the reaction energy of 2H20 -> 2H2 + O2 using DFT and then use a neural network to approximate the solutions faster.

documents.name: United Signs & EdgeXLed Web Development Contractor
documents.description: Took a contract to design and develop a client portal for a local digital sign company here in Atlanta, Georgia. I used AWS for the backend functionality while using a React frontend. Making uses of services like AWS lambda, AWS Route 53, AWS Cloudfront, AWS API Gateway, and more, the portal included tons of functionality including automatic email updates, price calculation, pdf quote generation, etc. while also having a clean modern look

documents.name: Geometry Tutoring
documents.description: Tutored a high school freshman in Geometry for the back half of her semester.

documents.name: Started the Magic: the Gathering Club at Georgia Tech
documents.description: This is when my roommate began the Magic: the Gathering Club here at Georgia Tech. We are now at 120+ members and have created a community in which people can chill and enjoy some MTG games together.

documents.name: Bloomberg LP Software Engineering Internship
documents.description: During the summer of 2021, I worked full-time at Bloomberg again as a software engineering intern. This time, however, I worked for the 120 Park Avenue New York location as a part of the Enterprise Metering team. My project had me looking into the pros and cons of migrating to Bloomberg's internal big data infrastructure from the existing Apache Kafka pipeline to land all the data into our team's HDFS Hadoop cluster. After weighing the upsides and downsides of the migration, I worked on creating a pipeline using the new software to run in parallel to the existing pipeline to directly compare the two methods. Nearing the end of my internship, I finally presented my findings to the team and assisted in the decision making for the future of the data pipeline

documents.name: Bloomberg LP Software Engineering Internship
documents.description: During my Fall 2020 semester I continued my work for the Dayton, NJ datacenter remotely from Atlanta, Georgia as a part-time intern. I began by integrating GraphQL with an existing internal REST API and begin the migration process over to GraphQL. To do so, I used Flask and Graphene. I also added functionality to the API to return system health information. Moving forward, I created an internal system health monitoring dashboard using React, Redux, and the Apollo Client that connected to the GraphQL api to read and display system health information for the server in the datacenters.

documents.name: Bloomberg LP Software Engineering Internship
documents.description: During the summer of 2020, I worked full-time at Bloomberg as a software engineering intern for the Dayton, NJ datacenter. I was a part of the Data Retention team, where I worked on a couple different things. The first project I was placed on involved me writing a scheduled script to proactively handle system health issues by reading in the file system info through different terminal commands and beginning the process to resolve any issues before they created alerts. The script was run through an internal RunBook Automation tool. Afterwards, I began to work on mock ups for a prototype server health monitoring dashboard and the back-end to support it. I continued this work in the Fall.

documents.name: Assistant Junior Taekwondo Instructor at MPAMA
documents.description: After training in taekwondo for around a decade and moving through the belt and leadership ranks, I became an instructor at Master Peter's Academy of Martial Arts (MPAMA). I worked part-time and taught curriculum, lead groups, built character within the students.

documents.name: NetElixer Digital Marketing Internship
documents.description: During summer 2019, I interned at a local digital marketing firm, where I learned the ins and outs of the digital marketing industry. As a part of the internship, I completed the Google Analytics and Google Ads Fundamentals Certifications and received training in Statistics & Forecasting, SEO Strategy & Content Development, Moden Paid Search Strategy, and Social Media Marketing. I also developed an AI Game to exhibit the capabilities and limitations of AI tools. Additionally, together with two other interns, I developed and pitched a digital marketing strategy to a client to the agency.

documents.name: Began Martial Arts Training
documents.description: This is around (the exact date is unknown) when I began my martial arts training as a 7-year old white belt.

documents.name: My Birthday
documents.description: This is the day that I was born!

documents.name: Araumi of the Dead Tide EDH Commander Deck
documents.description: Death won't stop one final encore.; A reanimation deck that will try to make explosive plays by getting three copies of creatures that scale exponentially using Araumi's ability. That could mean drawing cards with Floating-Dream Zubera, Agent of Treachery, or Inga Rune-Eyes. It could mean wiping my opponents' boards with Fleshbag Marauder effects, or Massacre Wurm. Or even lowering life totals using Massacre Wurm, Gary, or Sower of Discord.

documents.name: Edric, Spymaster of Trest EDH Commander Deck
documents.description: Swing, draw, play flying men, and lastly pass to my turn.; This deck is looking to close out games fast by dumping evasive bodies onto the board and then using Edric's ability to draw an absurd amount of cards. These cards likely will have board protection in the form of counterspells or other protection and extra spells to allow you to do it all over again. Finally, there are a few overrun style effects to eventually close out the game after looping extra turns.

documents.name: Golos, Tireless Pilgrim EDH Commander Deck
documents.description: Blink and you'll miss it!; A value-based blink deck that has a few combo win cons. The general game plan is to ramp into Golos, using his ETB trigger to find The World Tree, which will color-fix my lands for the rest of the game. Then use and reuse value ETB triggers from creatures like Gonti, Mulldrifter, Cloud Blazer, Mindclaw Shaman, and more until I find either the Peregrine Drake + Deadeye Navigator combo or the Eternal Witness/Skullwinder + Ghostly Flicker/Displace/Illusionist Stratagem + Peregrine Drake combo for infinite mana. ; Now, that Golos has been banned from EDH, I have multiple different options for the commander including Kenrith, Prismatic Bridge, Jegantha, and Garth. These cards and the swaps required for them are all in the sideboard and detailed here: https://bit.ly/3CM3zQV

documents.name: Jeleva, Nephalia's Scourge EDH Commander Deck
documents.description: Anything you can do, I can do better!

documents.name: Jodah, Archmage Eternal EDH Commander Deck
documents.description: Five-color good stuff!; The goal of this deck is to use Jodah to play 7+ mana spells that could end the game on the spot or gain me a ridiculous amount of advantage. Some of the most fun spells include the ones that flip spells from the top of my library, including Aminatou's Augury, Brilliant Ultimatum, Narset, and Etali. Lastly, an easy win-con for this deck is Enter the Infinite + Thassa's Oracle since Jodah allows us to cast Enter the Infinite for a mere 5 mana. As a backup plan, it is possible to just ramp up to these spells.

documents.name: Kruphix, God of Horizons EDH Commander Deck
documents.description: With that on the stack . . .; A control deck looking to do a couple of things: ramp, stop what your opponents are trying to do, draw cards, store a lot of mana, cast a 14 mana combo with protection up. The 14 mana combo is Enter the Infinite + Thassa's Oracle, which is the only win con of the deck, so it is important to have plenty of protection up when going for the win.

documents.name: Rionya, Fire Dancer EDH Commander Deck
documents.description: You know what's better than having 1 of something? Having lots of them!; This deck is looking to cast a few cheap instants and sorceries to allows Rionya's combat trigger to make lots of copies of a variety of creatures, including value creatures like Solemn Simulacrum and Mindclaw Shaman or even creatures that deal tons of damage in multiples like Terror of the Peaks, Scourge of Valkas, and Fanatic of Mogis.

documents.name: Tatyova, Benthic Druid EDH Commander Deck
documents.description: Card draw, ramp, and uhh . . . what else do you need in a deck again?; This deck is looking to do one thing: draw as many cards as possible by casting tons of ramp spells and using Tatyova's ability. Oh and I guess it should try to win too, so there is a combo win-con involving any of the creatures that tap to put a land into play, Simic Growth Chamber, and Retreat to Coralhelm. There are also some alternative win-cons including Avenger of Zendikar, Rampaging Baloths, and Multani, Yavimaya's Avatar.

documents.name: The Prismatic Bridge EDH Commander Deck
documents.description: Avengers Assemble!; This is a five-color superfriends deck that would like to dump as many Planeswalkers on the board as possible and keep any pesky creatures away from our friends. We do this by using board wipes and extra turn spells for us to buy time to get maximum value out of our Planeswalkers and ultimately try to ultimate them.

documents.name: Tuvasa the Sunlit EDH Commander Deck
documents.description: Play enchantments to draw cards to play enchantments to draw cards to . . .; This is a classic enchantress deck that will draw an absurd amount of cards by casting cheap utility enchantments and drawing cards off them using enchantresses. There are a couple of cards to make Tuvasa into a deadly attacker including Aqueous Form and Ancestral Mask since Tuvasa will already be growing as I cast many enchantments, but the primary win-con is the Enchanted Evening + Calming Verse combo. Another alternate win-con is Approach of the Second Sun, which is significantly tougher to pull off.

documents.name: Zaxara, the Exemplary EDH Commander Deck
documents.description: Blue-Sun's Zenith Tribal; The goal of this deck is to cast big blue sun's zenith-like cards. There are cards like Rishkar's Expertise and Greater Good to help draw even more cards using the X/Xs that Zaxara makes as well. The X/Xs are also good blockers to stay alive while basking in the glory of card draw. Finally, the win conditions of the deck are the Lab Man effects and a few overrun style effects.

documents.name: Zedruu the Greathearted EDH Commander Deck
documents.description: Who doesn't like free stuff right? Right?; This is an enchantment-based control deck that will try to stall the game out to draw as many cards as possible off Zedruu in the long run. Approach of the Second Sun is the primary win-con for this deck, but the token makers can also double as win-cons when you don't donate the tokens away for cards.

documents.name: VAEFaceGeneration
documents.description: This project uses a Variational AutoEcoder combined with the haar cascade face detector to create a latent space which can be used to generate images of faces from the training dataset. The data set must be provided as a folder full of images with people's faces in them. Then, it will find the faces, apply preprocessing, and train a VAE on them.

documents.name: SIR_modeling
documents.description: This is a project in which I wrote code to simulation the spread of infection using the SIR model. Analysis of the convergence and stability of the model is done in the report. Additionally, I used a Neuro-Evolution algorithm to design different vaccination models to minimize the amount of infected people while using minimal vaccines

documents.name: MineRL
documents.description: Applies the Deep Q Learning algorithm using a convolutional neural network to have an agent learn to fight zombies in a closed minecraft environment. This is done using Microsoft's Project Malmo (to create the environment) and tensorflow/keras to structure the network.

documents.name: GANColorifyMe
documents.description: Deep Convolutional Generative Adversarial Networks trained on a dataset of images of my face to generate gray 28x28 images of my face. Then, this image is send into another network (which first runs convolution and then deconvolution) to predict the colors of the image.

documents.name: DeepQLearningLibrary
documents.description: This is a deep q learning library built to work with a custom environment system I created. To apply it to gym environments I created a wrapper to convert a gym environment into my environment library.

documents.name: COVID-19-data-analysis
documents.description: Analysis of COVID-19 data collected by John Hopkins using python. Created many different models, including Markov Chains, Recursive LRC Circuits, Recurrent Neural Networks, Logistic Models, etc. Wrote a report based on the finding of the data analysis of growth rates, derivatives, etc.

documents.name: QuantumPhysicsWithDeepLearning
documents.description: Trains a keras neural network on data of the solved schrodinger's equation. The inputs of this model are samples from the potential from within the infinite asymmetric potential well and the output is samples from the solved wavefunction. The data is collected by solving the schrodinger's equation using a numeric method called the Runge-Kutta method.

documents.name: BikeShareSimulation
documents.description: This project aims to simulate bike share (like Citi Bike) in a simulated city. It uses address and data from CitiBike in New York to base the simulation probabilities from. The simulation is a discrete event simulation which uses a system I wrote to schedule and handle the events.

documents.name: CircuitSimulation
documents.description: This repo aims to create a software based (with C++ api) circuit simulator that simulators combinational and sequential logic by stubbing the transistor class and building from there. Eventually, the goal is to build a computer like the LC3 in this simulator.

documents.name: ConwaysGameOfLife
documents.description: This is a Conway's Game of Life simulator that allows for an infinite grid. Further, it allows for loading patterns from a variety of sources allowing for easy prototyping of new patterns and demos. See the README for more details.

documents.name: InverseDensityFunctionalTheory
documents.description: The goal of the project was to create a neural network that predicts the input to DFT from the results of the experiment. The uses cases for this are to use higher level wave function theories to produce accurate densities and then predict the XC potential that produces a similar output with density functional theory (which will run much faster).

documents.name: TuringMachineSimulator
documents.description: This is a python program in which I simulated everything a turing machine can do. Essentially, after you create an object of the Turing Machine class and add the appropriate transitions, the code can run the turing machine computations given an initial state of the tape. It also produces a list of snapshots of the configurations of the machine.

documents.name: JMathLib
documents.description: This is java library that can do a lot of math including concepts from statistics, linear algebra, and calculus. It is mostly focused on linear algebra for now since that has to most application, but I will add more to it.

documents.name: FlappyBirdBot
documents.description: I used a genetic algorithm to train a neural network to play my version of the game flappy bird. I trained a variety of different models for many different configurations of the game and stored them into files.

documents.name: GridWorld
documents.description: A text-based grid world framework for reinforcement learning agents to play around in. In general, the goal for the agent is to solve the maze in as few steps as possible. This is done using plenty of reinforcement learning algorithms including policy iteration, value iteration, sarsa, monte carlo methods, and iterative policy evaluation.

documents.name: NeuralNetwork
documents.description: This is an artificial neural network that I have created from scratch using my math library in java. I have used it to recognize handwritten digits using the mnist dataset and even classify certain flowers. It uses concepts of supervised learning and stochastic gradient descent.

documents.name: PyEncrypt
documents.description: An encryption framework built in python using object-oriented programming and different ciphering/encryption algorithms. Currently has support for well-known ciphers like RSA and the Caesar cipher and more. Also has the functionality to show all the steps of encryption to make encryption more explainable.

documents.name: MtgClubSite
documents.description: This repository holds the source code for the MTG@Tech club website at Georgia Tech.

documents.name: api.bhagat.io
documents.description: Personal API including many functionalities including the backend of my website, a GraphQL endpoint with information on my projects and mtg decks, and more. It uses various technologies in the background, including mongodb as the database, the github api, puppeteer for webscraping, the discord api, the scryfall api, and more.

documents.name: bhagat.io
documents.description: My portfolio personal website with details such as my experience, projects, resume, hobbies and more!

documents.name: WebcamPreprocessor
documents.description: Uses the OpenCV Utils library that I created to preprocess the images sent to applications from my webcam to add some fun effects to them. This works for any video calls and even recording software.

documents.name: ThreeBodyProblem
documents.description: Uses pygame and some basic physics and differential equations to simulate the effects of gravity for n bodies.

documents.name: Timer
documents.description: This is a node app that can be used to have a synced timer between multiple devices.

documents.name: MontyHallSimulation
documents.description: Simulates the Monty Hall problem using python. Created a game script to allow the user to try playing and another script to run the simulation using the optimal choice many times and see the average results.

documents.name: CrossLangComms
documents.description: A TCP server that allows for different languages to use shared memory to share variables and send messages to each other. This shared memory is stored within the java TCP server using a ConcurrentHashMap. I have created clients for the server for some of the bigger languages and am working on creating clients for more.

documents.name: OpenCVPythonUtils
documents.description: A package created to optimize the workflow of my future computer vision projects. This package setups up cameras, parses command line arguments, streams video, and even creates virtual webcams from the video input you specify (which could be a camera or a video file).

documents.name: EnvironmentalJusticeGatechWebsite
documents.description: This is a website that I created to raise awareness about the enviornmental injustices occuring around the world and specifically in Atlanta, Georgia. The target audience is Georgia Tech students, but it is available for anyone to view. It uses firebase firestore as the databse to store all the events and programs.

documents.name: VikingTutors
documents.description: This is a website for students to access online learning material specific to our school. I created this using firebase as the database and authentication so that only students of our school can watch the videos and only teachers can upload. I have also added zoom integration for live streams and used the youtube api to display videos.

documents.name: GlobalTemperatureDataAnalysis
documents.description: Using the same framework from the COVID-19 data analysis project to display a dashboard of different views of the global climate data. The analysis shows troubling trends that need to be slowed if we want the Earth to continue to continue to be sustainable.

documents.name: ReverseShell
documents.description: This is a python program that connects a client to a TCP server and then gives the server access to the client's terminal by running the commands that the server sends using the os library.

documents.name: StreamsUtil
documents.description: Utility functions and classes for java streams. This repository currently includes server and client classes to send data to each other using tcp streams.

documents.name: SecurityCamera
documents.description: This is a project that uses the webcam and opencv to detect motion, email me a video of this motion, detect faces, and more. I made a google form to control this camera to through a phone.

documents.name: PaintDuplicate
documents.description: Paint duplicate using java graphics. Has many of the same functionality as paint including drawing, perfect shapes, perfect lines, etc. I also added some motion to some of the edit modes so it is possible to make objects float around or even jitter.

documents.name: HomeServer
documents.description: This is a server running in my home made using nodejs and express that I made to host files, control some of the smart devices in my house, and even send me emails when needed.

documents.name: Rutherford-Scattering
documents.description: Rutherford scattering simulation using Jupyter notebook and python.

documents.name: JuliaSets
documents.description: This project creates visualizations for Julia sets with different parameter configurations. Using java graphics and UI tools, the program is fully configurable from the GUI itself and it can create beautiful visualizations.

documents.name: AStarPathfinding
documents.description: Uses the A* Pathfinding algorithm to make an enemy that will chase you throughout a map with houses and different types of terrain. The goal is to not get caught. Also, half the objects in the map are moving!

documents.name: CollegeData
documents.description: I applied a neural network that I coded myself (or the option to use a tensorflow model) on a college dataset so that it would predict your chances of making a college from our high school (South Brunswick High School) based on GPA and SAT/ACT. I also used a genetic algorithm to optimize the hyperparameters of the neural network.

documents.name: 3DMazeGame
documents.description: A 3D Maze game in which you walk around a maze and can only see what's in front of you. There are portals and traps along the way to throw you off as well. You may either use the keyboard to control the character or the website from any other device on the network. Lastly, you can also just click a key to allow a reinforcement learning algorithm to solve the maze for you if you get lazy.

documents.name: AIBattleGame
documents.description: AI Battle game that I created while interning at NetElixir.

documents.name: SlackLogger
documents.description: A program that redirects the stdout output to my slack channel for better remote monitoring.

documents.name: ExperimentalPI
documents.description: Uses a Monte Carlo random simulation to find the value of PI using Octave/Matlab. The Monte Carlo simulation works by generating random points in a two-dimensional grid and using the area ratios of the circle to square and the number of points the fall into the circle to calculate PI.

documents.name: NumberRecognizer
documents.description: Uses the Neural Network API I created to create a handwritten digit recognizer wrapped in an android app. The user can draw a number on the canvas and the app will guess what number it is.

documents.name: SmartRoom
documents.description: This serves a React app that connects to my Home Server to control some of the smart home devices in my house (mainly in my room). It makes them voice-controlled rather than only controlled by my phone.

documents.name: CheeseMoon
documents.description: This is a game that I created to show a fake origin of the moon and why it is a ball of cheese. It is a 3D game made with unity and you go on a quest to win a giant cheese ball contest, but when things don't go your way . . .

documents.name: ServerData
documents.description: This is a react app that connects to a python server to visualize, modify, and analyze some old server data. It has a variety of ways to effectively edit, save, and share a copy of modified data. Using machine learning and other data analysis methods, this app can also predict certain values and analyze the performance of some servers.

documents.name: MachineLearningLearning
documents.description: These are some machine learning algorithms that I implemented while learning them using a youtube playlist. I first coded it by hand, then used a higher-level library named sklearn to do it.

documents.name: JavaFxFramework
documents.description: A JavaFx Framework that will allow developers to create JavaFx games without having to deal with all the setup. Also includes additional features such as input controllers, servers, and more.

documents.name: RishavsGame
documents.description: This is a fun game that I created using python and pygame in the Computer Science Club during my freshman year of high school. It includes modified versions of many classic games such as flappy bird, brick breaker, crossy road, etc.

documents.name: PS4MouseMove
documents.description: This is a python program using pygame that allows you to use your ps4 controller as a mouse. It can left and right click and move the mouse all with the controller.

documents.name: WaterReminder
documents.description: This is a python program that will make sure that someone does not forget to drink water. When the program is run, you have to enter in the email of the person you want to remind.
